Ye can always pretend to be a bloodthirsty {{noun1}}, threatening everyone by waving yer {{adjective1}} {{noun2}} in the air, but until ye learn to {{verb1}} like a pirate ye'll never be {{adverb1}} accepted as an authentic {{noun3}}.

So here's what ye do : Cleverly work into your daily conversations {{adjective2}} pirate phrases such as "Ahoy there, {{pluralNoun1}}", "Avast, ye {{pluralNoun2}}", and "Shiver me {{pluralNoun3}}". Remember to drop all yer g's when ye say such words as sailin', spittin', and fightin'. This will give ye a/an {{bodyPart1}} start to be recognized as a swashbucklin' {{noun4}}.

Once ye have the lingo down pat, it helps to wear a three-cornered {{noun5}} on yer head, stash a/an {{noun6}} in yer pants, and keep a/an {{noun7}} perched atop yer {{bodyPart2}}. Aye, now ye be a real pirate!
